word: They will level you to the ground—
parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To dash to the ground, level with the ground. From edaphos; to raze.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.
A stone; met: of Jesus as the chief stone in a building. Apparently a primary word; a stone.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
A stone; met: of Jesus as the chief stone in a building. Apparently a primary word; a stone.
A primary particle; opposite, i.e. Instead or because of.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time. Of uncertain affinity; an occasion, i.e. Set or proper time.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From episkeptomai; inspection; by implication, superintendence; specially, the Christian 'episcopate'.
